JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: ABA assistant Trainer – with an interest in Neurological disorders, Valby (near Copenhagen), Denmark
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
We are an English family who moved to Denmark, Valby area 3 years ago. 6 months after our arrival our young son was diagnosed with Autism, we are in the home training program and are looking for an assistant.

Our son is an intelligent, quick-learning, cheerful 4 ½ year old boy who is currently nonverbal. Within the program we seek a support worker to join our team to assist and generalize the training methods. The Method is ABA, but the focus is that activities and training are fun and play based. The games are focused on addressing the developmental areas of Social Behavior, Cognitive areas, communication, and verbal interaction.

Ideally you will have a psychology background with prior experience working/interacting with young children, interested in working closely with us the parents but also gaining the knowledge directly from our psychologist who is an expert in Neurological disorders and developmental issues.

Key skills:
• Enthusiastic
• Confident with children (4 ½) year old
• Able to interact in creative fun games.
• Funny and social
• Available for between 5 hours per week (potentially some weekends, negotiable)
• Willing to learn ABA Therapy methods - PRT (pivotal response training) NET (Natural environmental training)
• Potentially willing to travel on Holidays.



Please forward your CV/ brief introduction letters to Lorena Connolly iuby.lulu@yahoo.com and Adam Connolly at adam.connolly78@gmail.com so we can arrange a follow up meeting to expand on how we could work together.

Being eager to learn and have fun while interacting with our son is the key to becoming part of our team, we look forward to welcoming you onto our team.
